title: SpaceX to close out third quarter with record-breaking Starlink mission
summary: SpaceX is set to close the third quarter of 2023 with its 70th launch of the year. The mission, Starlink Group 6-19, is set to lift off this Friday, Sept. 29, at 6:39 PM EDT (22:29 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40), at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

title: Investing in Space: Japan’s ispace opens Denver headquarters as companies chase moon market
summary: It seems like everyone wants to go to the moon these days, with serious lunar programs underway in China, India, Japan and the United States. One company is pushing to tap two of those markets: Tokyo-based lunar lander company ispace is rebooting its U.S. subsidiary, aiming to be a key transportation provider in the nascent moon business.

title: Germany Commits €2M to Fund Offshore Launch Infrastructure
summary:
The German government has committed €2 million to support the development of infrastructure that would enable the country to support the launch of microlaunchers from German territory. “Microlaunchers are a cutting-edge technology and will enable further innovations. At the same time, this initiative strengthens Germany’s and the EU’s strategic autonomy,” explained Member of Parliament from […]
The post Germany Commits €2M to Fund Offshore Launch Infrastructure appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Eutelsat and OneWeb combine to create European satellite giant as Musk’s Starlink pressures sector
summary: OneWeb, the British satellite giant, completed its combination with French rival Eutelsat Thursday, setting the stage for a European challenger to Elon Musk’s space internet venture Starlink.

title: UK to Provide £65M for High-Risk, High-Reward Space Tech Projects
summary:
The UK Space Agency has announced plans to make £65 million of funding available for what it refers to as “high-risk, high-reward” projects that could boost the United Kingdom’s leadership in space technologies and applications. Managed through the National Space Innovation Programme (NSIP), which was founded in 2020, the initiative will be focused on developing […]
The post UK to Provide £65M for High-Risk, High-Reward Space Tech Projects appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Mynaric optical terminals selected for Northrop Grumman satellites pass key tests
summary: Mynaric’s laser communications terminals passed key ground tests required to be deployed on Space Development Agency satellites

title: Eutelsat completes multi-orbit OneWeb merger after shareholder vote
summary: Eutelsat has combined its geostationary satellite business with OneWeb’s low Earth orbit constellation after shareholders voted Sept. 28 in favor of the all-share deal.

title: FAA closes New Shepard mishap investigation
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration announced Sept. 26 it had closed the mishap investigation into a failed launch by Blue Origin’s New Shepard vehicle more than a year ago, but said the vehicle is not yet cleared to resume flights.

title: X-Bow to demonstrate additive manufacturing of solid rocket motors for U.S. Air Force
summary: The U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory awarded X-Bow Systems, a startup that specializes in solid rocket propulsion, a $17.8 million contract to demonstrate additive manufacturing technologies.

title: SpaceX wins first Pentagon contract for Starshield, its satellite network for military use
summary: The Pentagon has awarded Elon Musk’s SpaceX its first confirmed contract for the Starshield network it’s developing, a military-specific version of the company’s Starlink satellite internet system, the defense agency said Wednesday.
